titleStmt.title: A message sent from the King of Scots, and the Duke of York's court in Flanders to the Lord Douglas, and Collonel Brown, to be communicated to the rest of the nobility and gentry in the Scottish nation, with proposals and overtures, for the composing of all differences, the submitting to Counsel, and the preventing of a universal desolation.
titleStmt.author: Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
Culpepper, C.
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
